class db.models.Currencies(**kwargs)

Relational Object to CurrencyUpdateDates

currency_updates:

Relational Object to CurrencyUpdates

CurrencyUpdateDates

class db.models.CurrencyUpdateDates(**kwargs)

Bases: Base

Date on which a currency rate was saved along with the base rate.

id: Auto increment unique id

created:

Date on which the update was saved

Foreign Key to Currencies

base_currency:

Relational Object to Currencies

Relational Object to CurrencyUpdates

CurrencyUpdates

class db.models.CurrencyUpdates(**kwargs)

Bases: Base

Currency rate updates

id: Auto increment unique id

currency_id:

Foreign Key to Currencies

currency:

Relational Object to Currencies

date_updated_id:

Foreign Key to CurrencyUpdateDates

date_updated:

Relational Object to CurrencyUpdateDates

rate:

Currency rate.

User

class db.models.User(**kwargs)

Bases: Base

User model to implement authentication

id: Auto increment unique id

username: Username

email: Email

full_name: Full name

full_name: is the user disabled and not allowed to login

password: hashed password

Currency Database Interface using SQLAlchemy ORM

class db.currency_db.CurrencyDB(session: Session, engine: AsyncEngine)

Bases: object

Interface to the Currency Database.

Parameters

  • session (required) – SQLAlchemy Session object.

  • engine (required) – SQLAlchemy AsyncEngine object.

async add_update(base_curr: str, update: Dict[str, float], for_date: Optional[str] = None) → None

Add a currency update to DB.

Parameters

  • base_curr (required) – Base currency of the update.

  • update (required) – Dictionary of currency_code:rate pairs.

  • for_date (optional) – Particular date to record the update against, in the “%d-%m-%Y” format, particularly useful in tests. If no date is provided, the current date is used.

Raises

ValueError – If the date is not in the “%d-%m-%Y” format.

Returns

None

async add_user(username: str, password: str, email: Optional[str] = None, full_name: Optional[str] = None, disabled: bool = False) → None

Add user to DB

Parameters

  • username (required) – Username

  • password (required) – Password

  • email (optional) – Email

  • full_name (optional) – Full name

  • disabled (optional) – If the user is to be added as disabled True or False

Returns

User if found

None if not found

async convert_rate(from_curr_code: str, to_curr_code: str, amount: float, on_date: Optional[str] = None) → Dict[str, Any]

Convert currency from one to another based on the rate on the given date.

If a date is not provided, the date from the last update is used.

Parameters

  • from_curr_code (required) – Currency code to convert from.

  • to_curr_code (required) – Currency code to convert to.

  • amount (required) – Amount to be converted

  • on_date (optional) – Currency rates from this date will be used if provided.

Raises

ValueError – Propogated from exception stack

Returns

dict of Currency rate converted from -> to, base currency and last updated date of the currency from the external API

async get_currency(curr_code: str) → Currencies

Get currency object, raise error if it does not exist.

Parameters

curr_code (required) – Currency code.

Raises

ValueError – If currency code not found in database.

Returns

db.models.Currencies

async get_currency_codes() → List[str]

Get a list of all the currency codes available in the DB.

Returns

list

async get_or_create(curr_code: str) → Currencies

Get currency object, create it if it does not exist.

Parameters

curr_code (required) – Currency code.

Returns

db.models.Currencies

get_pwd_hash(plain: str) → str

Get hashed password from plain text

Parameters

plain (required) – Plain text

Returns

str hashed password

async get_rate_on_date(curr_code: str, on_date: Optional[str] = None) → CurrencyUpdates

Get last rate updated in DB for a particular date and currency code.

If a date is not provided, the date from the last update is used.

Parameters

  • curr_code (required) – Currency code.

  • on_date (optional) – Particular date for which to get the rate, in the “%d-%m-%Y” format

Raises

  • ValueError – If the date is not in the “%d-%m-%Y” format.

  • ValueError – If an empty result is returned from the query.

Returns

CurrencyUpdates if the query returns a result else raises ValueError

async get_user(username: str) → Optional[User]

Get User object from DB

Parameters

username (required) – Username

Returns

User if found

None if not found

property last_update_date: CurrencyUpdateDates

Get the DB object corresponding to the last update from external currency API.

Returns

db.models.CurrencyUpdateDates
